availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph E. Gregg (Scott County, Kentucky, farmer, nurseryman, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer, nurseryman, and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Zerelda Johnson Gregg in Scott County, Kentucky, on June 20, 1844. Father of Penelope Gregg, Cynthia Adelia Gregg, Malvina Gregg, Henry Francis Gregg, Joseph Breckenridge Gregg, Mary Serene Gregg, and Minerva Gregg. Farmer in Scott County in 1850. Farmer and nurseryman in Scott County in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Scott County in 1862. Died in Scott County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 437A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 835.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Scott County Marriages, Film #000183225.
KYR-0001-031-0029.
